Class Card

java.lang.Object
edu.wit.scds.ds.lists.app.card_game.universal_base.card.CardBase
edu.wit.scds.ds.lists.app.card_game.standard_cards.card.Card
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<CardBase>
public final class Card extends CardBase
Representation of a playing card with a suit and rank - Ace (lowest) to King (highest)

The suit and rank are immutable.

Note: we will override all superclass methods that our game uses which return a CardBase reference to reduce/eliminate the need to cast to Card, particularly for fluent methods

Version:
1.0 2020-11-19 initial version, 2.0 2021-12-08
  • add support for face up/down
  • add matches()
, 2.1 2022-11-06 support dynamic switching to compare cards based on suit and rank or rank alone, 2.2 2024-03-26
  • minor cosmetic changes
  • revise toString() for greater formatting flexibility and control
, 3.0 2025-03-25 track changes to Suit and addition of Color, 4.0 2025-03-30 switch comparison from suit then rank to rank then suit, 5.0 2025-06-26
  • make subclass of Card to support different kinds of cards
  • move general constants, fields, and methods to Card
  • track changes to other Card-related classes
, 6.0 2025-07-11
  • track changes to UniversalBaseCard fka Card
  • rename this class from StandardCard to Card
  • eliminate our toString() because UniversalBaseCard's was re-tooled to do the work
  • add null-argument checking
  • override fluent methods used in our game
, 7.0 2025-07-13 remove all inner class Comparators, 8.0 2025-11-04 change comparison control from true/false to an enum to support more combinations of comparison including disabling them, 8.1 2025-11-19 add support for template cards
Author:
Dave Rosenberg

    • matches

      public boolean matches(CardBase otherBaseCard)
      Compare two cards to see if they match, which may be different from them being equal()

      The game or Pile class may require this method to behave differently from equals() or compareTo() which will be implemented in the game-specific Card class.

      Note: this implementation uses equals() to perform the match functionality which may be overridden in a subclass

      prevents comparison if disabled

      Overrides:
      matches in class CardBase
      Parameters:
      otherBaseCard - the card to compare against this card
      Returns:
      true if the cards match, false otherwise

    • compareOnNone

      private static boolean compareOnNone()
      convenience method to determine if comparisons of cards is disabled
      Returns:
      true if comparisons should not be done, false otherwise

    • compareOnRank

      private static boolean compareOnRank()
      convenience method to determine if rank should be considered when comparing two cards
